components.code:
This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is. To send data to the default output use `send(somedata);` To send data to specific output when number of outputs > 1 use `$.send('outputX', somedata)` where `X` is output index, see example bellow: - first output--> `send(somedata)` or `$.send('output', somedata)` - second output --> `$.send('output2', somedata)` - ... - 5th output --> `$.send('output5', somedata)` - etc.
Number of outputs
Code:

components.c2skhf5f0f:
The component shows data in a template. Hovering over the value shows the last update time. Assuming this incomming data: ```javascript { speed: 1, nested: { value: 2 }, array: [{ value: 3 }] } ``` The paths bust be defined as: ``` speed // -> 1 nested.value // -> 2 array.0.value // -> 3 ```
Update interval (in ms)
Leave empty to update immediately when new data comes in.
Properties to show in the template
Path supports js dot notation like `data.arr.0.value`, following is not supported `data.arr[0].value`
Supports datatypes in the `path` column: `some.path | date`
Date format
default `dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss`
Extend previous data?
if checked the previous data will be extend instead of overwriten, useful when not all data comes in a single message
NAME

components.c5dxrb9e03:
# GPIO __Write mode__: - Select the GPIO you want - Set the read/write option to write - Send true to the component to set the GPIO to HIGH - Send false to the component to set the GPIO to LOW __Read mode__: - Select the GPIO you want - Set the read/write option to write - Send true to the node so read the state of the gpio
GPIO
read/write
Raspberry GPIO
components.c5nc4c74b:
This component implements the [Total.js API Router](https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/cc674001rr51c/#total-js-routing) that allows you to provide only one endpoint (route) by adding multiple endpoints divided by keys. The component expects REST Route message or data in the form: ```js { "schema": "schema_name/{param_1}/{param_2}?query=arguments", "data": {} // optional, request payload } ``` < __Good to know:__
Output data will be the same `data`, but extendend by adding new properties declared below. __Extended output data:__ - `id {String}` first value from dynamic value - `params {Object}` dynamic values - `query {Object}` query arguments - `user {Object}` optional, inherited from the controller - `session {Object}` optional, inherited from the controller - `ip {String}` optional, inherited from the controller If the controller is stored in the `message.refs.controller` property, then its properties like `controller.id`, `controller.params` and `controller.query` will be extendend by values from parsed schema.
Name
Send next
Load data from the specific property/field
Optional. The data for the model will be loaded from the specific property/field.
Color
Icon
Rewrite value only (otherwise, it will replace entire message data)
Every name of identifier must be unique per Flow. You can use dynamic arguments in the form {argument_name}
Use names in lower-case. We recommend to keep e.g. users_read/{id} or products_read/{id}
components.c6n8c4704c:
This component registers an HTTP Route and sends request data next. It stores `controller` instance in the `message.refs.controller` property. You must respond to the REST response component. < __IMPORTANT__:
The component works only with a defined Proxy endpoint in the Flow settings. < __URL__:
The URL must be relative to the defined Proxy endpoint. So if the endpoint is `/users/` and the desired address is `http://example.com/users/find` then the value must be `/find` __Output data__: ```js { "route": String, "params": Object, "query": Object, "body": Object, "files": Array, "headers": Object, "url": String, "ip": String } ```
No proxy endpoint defined.
This component will not work until then. Please go to main screen, open settings of this FlowStream instance and set the Endpoint.
Method
Relative URL address
Relative path to:
Timeout
Request limit
Send to output
NAME

Uses server-side implementation of [Tangular](https://docs.totaljs.com/components/40d06002lm50c/) **Example:** Incomming data ```js { app_name: 'Total.js Flow' } ``` Template ``` App name: {{ app_name }} ``` $ --> {MessageInstance} https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/40844001ni51c/ In the example bellow, the $.refs.controller is only available if the message was created by the Route component ``` URL: {{ $.refs.controller.url }} ```

components.cheerio:
Uses [Cheerio](https://cheerio.js.org/index.html) Please refer to the [documentation](https://cheerio.js.org/classes/Cheerio.html) for available functions. ## Input ```js ``` ## Output ```js { result: , input: } ``` ## Example code ```js // instance : component instance // $: cheerio instance // html: html string var txt = []; $('ul > li').each(function (i, elem) { txt.push($(this).text()); }); return txt; ```
Path to html
Leave empty if the 'data' itself is the html string, otherwise use dot notation. E.g.: { request: { body: '<html>...</html>' }} -> `request.body`
Code:
Available variables: '$' -> cheerio instance, 'html' -> html string. Use 'return somedata;' to return whatever you want. Output data -> { result: somedata, input: inputdata }
NAME

components.dataset:
Name
Type
Calculate the sum
Unit
Decimals
Icon
Color
 The component stores data as CSV Dataset for e.g. Dashboard application. Dataset is stored in `/private/` path that is available with the help of the Flow access token. CSV file contains only processed values (according to the period) and the `.meta` file contains meta data + last value. ```js { key: String, // optional, e.g. device_id | device_name value: Number // measured value } ``` ### CSV columns 1. `key {String}` 1. `value {Number}` 1. `min {Number}` 1. `max {Number}` 1. `sum {Number}` 1. `count {Number}` 1. `tshour {Number}`in the form `yyyyMMddhh` 1. `tsday {Number}` in the form `yyyyMMdd` 1. `tsweek {Number}` in the form `yyyyww` 1. `tsmonth {Number}` in the form `yyyyMM` 1. `tsyear {Number}` in the form `yyyy`
NAME
